sense.name: pole
sense.commentary: an upright consisting of a piece of timber or metal fixed firmly in an upright position set up to mark something
sense.examples: He set a row of posts in the ground and strung wire between them. A pair of posts marked the goal. The corner of the lot was indicated by a post.

sense.name: station
sense.commentary: the position where someone (as a guard or a sentry) stands or is assigned to stand
sense.examples: A soldier manned the entrance post. A sentry station was set up outside the fence.

sense.name: job
sense.commentary: position, berth, office, spot, billet, place, situation - a job in an organization
sense.examples: He occupied a post in the treasury.

sense.name: letters
sense.commentary: mail - any particular collection of letters or packages that is delivered
sense.examples: Your post is on the table. Is there any post for me? She was opening her post.

sense.name: delivery
sense.commentary: POST[+event] the delivery and collection of letters and packages
sense.examples: It came by the first post. If you hurry you'll catch the post.

sense.name: postal service
sense.commentary: mail service, mail - the system whereby messages are transmitted via the post office
sense.examples: The post handles billions of items every day. He works for the US post service. In England, they call mail "the post".

sense.name: installation
sense.commentary: military post - military installation at which a body of troops is stationed
sense.examples: This military post provides an important source of income for the town nearby. There is an officer's club on the post.

sense.name: Ms. Post
sense.commentary: Post, Emily Post, Emily Price Post - US female author who wrote a book and a syndicated newspaper column on etiquette (1872 - 1960)
sense.examples: I bought her a book by Emily Post.

sense.name: Mr. Wiley Post
sense.commentary: US aviator who in 1933 made the first solo flight around the world (1899 - 1935)

sense.name: Mr. Charles William Post
sense.commentary: C.W. Post - US manufacturer of breakfast cereals and Postum (1854 - 1914)
sense.examples: I only buy cereals made by Post. Mr. Post makes the best cereals. C. W. Post college is named after Mr. Post.
